intro: Coopernookia, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its evergreen leaves are typically leathery and arranged in whorls around the stem. Coopernookia thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
